name: Draw2DElement$Builder
description: A nested builder within Draw2DElement that provides a fluent API for creating and configuring Draw2DElement instances.
overview:
The Draw2DElement$Builder class is a nested builder within Draw2DElement that provides a fluent API for creating and configuring Draw2DElement instances. This builder implements the builder pattern, allowing you to construct complex Draw2DElement objects with all their properties set through a chainable, readable API.

The builder is the recommended way to create Draw2DElement instances, as it provides type safety, method chaining, and validation during the construction process. It's typically accessed through parent container methods like draw2DBuilder().

constructors.description: The builder constructor takes a parent container and a Draw2D instance to wrap. In most cases, you won't call this constructor directly - instead, you'll obtain a builder through the parent container's draw2DBuilder() method.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The parent container that will contain the element

methods.name: x
methods.description: Sets the x-position of the element.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x-coordinate relative to the parent

examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .x(100); // Position at x=100

methods.name: getX
methods.description: Gets the currently set x-coordinate.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const currentX = builder.getX();

methods.name: y
methods.description: Sets the y-position of the element.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y-coordinate relative to the parent

examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .y(50); // Position at y=50

methods.name: getY
methods.description: Gets the currently set y-coordinate.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const currentY = builder.getY();

methods.name: pos
methods.description: Sets both x and y positions simultaneously.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .pos(100, 50); // Position at (100, 50)

methods.name: width
methods.description: Sets the width of the element and creates a fixed-size supplier. Throws IllegalArgumentException if width is negative.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the element (must be non-negative)

examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .width(200); // Set width to 200 pixels

methods.name: getWidth
methods.description: Gets the currently set width.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const currentWidth = builder.getWidth();

methods.name: height
methods.description: Sets the height of the element and creates a fixed-size supplier. Throws IllegalArgumentException if height is negative.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the element (must be non-negative)

examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .height(150); // Set height to 150 pixels

methods.name: getHeight
methods.description: Gets the currently set height.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const currentHeight = builder.getHeight();

methods.name: size
methods.description: Convenience method to set both width and height simultaneously.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .size(300, 200); // Set size to 300x200 pixels

methods.name: scale
methods.description: Sets the scale factor for the element. Scale affects both size and visual appearance. Throws IllegalArgumentException if scale is not positive.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: The scale factor (must be greater than 0)

examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .scale(1.5); // Make element 50% larger

methods.name: getScale
methods.description: Gets the currently set scale factor.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const currentScale = builder.getScale();

methods.name: rotation
methods.description: Sets the rotation angle for the element. Positive values rotate clockwise.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .rotation(45); // Rotate 45 degrees clockwise

methods.name: getRotation
methods.description: Gets the currently set rotation angle in degrees.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const currentRotation = builder.getRotation();

methods.name: rotateCenter
methods.description: Sets whether rotation should occur around the element's center point or its origin.

parameters.name: rotateCenter
parameters.description: Whether to rotate around the center

examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .rotateCenter(true); // Rotate around center

methods.name: isRotatingCenter
methods.description: Gets the current center rotation setting.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const centerRotation = builder.isRotatingCenter();

methods.name: zIndex
methods.description: Sets the z-index for render ordering. Higher values appear on top.

parameters.name: zIndex
parameters.description: The z-index value for render ordering

examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .zIndex(5); // Render above elements with lower z-index

methods.name: getZIndex
methods.description: Gets the currently set z-index.
examples:
const builder = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D());
const currentZIndex = builder.getZIndex();

methods.name: build
methods.description: Creates the Draw2DElement with the configured properties but does not add it to the parent container.
examples:
const element = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .x(100)
    .y(50)
    .width(200)
    .height(100)
    .build(); // Element is created but not added

methods.name: buildAndAdd
methods.description: Creates the Draw2DElement with the configured properties and automatically adds it to the parent container.
examples:
const element = hud.draw2DBuilder(Hud.createDraw2D())
    .x(100)
    .y(50)
    .width(200)
    .height(100)
    .buildAndAdd(); // Element is created and added to parent
